intro: Lysiclesia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces bright orange to yellow flowers that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, while its stems are slender and twining. Lysiclesia panamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and along stream banks.
